task.title: Creating a Mini Table of Contents
task.shortdesc: These are the steps for creating a Mini Table of Contents using the ePublisher system.

context.p: As in all the previous examples, the ePublisher systems allows the content creator to include special tags in the source documents. ePublisher will read these tags and then alter the HTML5 document set according to the instructions provided from the ePublisher stationery. The steps below list how and where to add the tag to the source documents.

step.cmd: Locate a topic in your source documents where you would like a Mini Table of Contents to appear.
Apply a predetermined output class to the title within the <Title> element.
Use ePublisher to generate the HTML5 Document set.
In the generated HTML5 document set, navigate to the tagged area to verify the mini Table of Contents was created.

result.p: Those are the steps needed to generate a fully functional mini Table of Contents in an ePublisher generated HTML5 document set. This is just one of the several features ePublisher comes pre-programed with to help you get the most out of your documentation.
